summary: Atlanta is the capital and biggest city in Georgia, USA. It has a population of over 500,000 and is part of a large metropolitan area with over 6 million people. Originally a railroad town, it grew quickly and became a major transportation hub. During the Civil War, it was an important Confederate city but was mostly destroyed in a fire. After the war, Atlanta became an industrial and technology center. It played a significant role in the civil rights movement and hosted the 1996 Summer Olympics, which boosted its economy and development. Today, Atlanta has a diverse economy and is known for its transportation, healthcare, media, and technology industries.
title: Atlanta
